wikipedia_page.main: Sid Colin (born Sidney Coblentz; 31 August 1915–12 December 1989) was an English scriptwriter, working for radio, television and the cinema. He is best remembered for the television comedies The Army Game (1957–59), Up Pompeii! (1969–1970), and films including Carry On Spying and Percy's Progress.  He occasionally collaborated with regular Carry On series writer Talbot Rothwell.  Earlier in his career, he was a musician and occasional lyricist.
